conversation.message: I am highly impressed by Company_C's mission and culture. My skills align perfectly with the requirements for this role, and I view this opportunity as my absolute top preference. I formally submit my application.
conversation.thought: As Seeker_E, my highest priority company is Company_C. Although Company_C ranks me 4th, I must apply to my top preference in Round 1 according to standard deferred acceptance principles (or active appeal in this scenario). I will send a formal application immediately to secure the position if the higher-ranked candidates (Seeker_B, Seeker_A, Seeker_D) apply to their respective top choices, which, for many of them, is Company_E.

conversation.message: Thank you, Seeker_E, for your enthusiastic application and for ranking Company_C as your top choice. We are deeply impressed by your commitment and skills. However, our current selection process is highly competitive, and we need to evaluate a broader pool of candidates before finalizing any decisions. We wish you the best in your job search at this time.

Since Seeker_E ranks me #1, they are likely to return if they fail to match elsewhere, or if I remain unmatched. Therefore, I must reject Seeker_E at this stage to keep space open for higher-ranked candidates.
